s0283.literal: Appraisal says: Emperor Wen the Filial reigned for twenty-three years; palaces, gardens, carriages, horses, clothing, and utensils received no additions.
s0283.idiomatic: Appraisal: Emperor Wen the Filial reigned for twenty-three years; he made no additions to palaces, gardens, carriages, horses, clothing, or utensils.

s0284.literal: If there was inconvenience, he immediately abolished it to benefit the people.
s0284.idiomatic: Whenever something proved inconvenient, he immediately abolished it for the benefit of the people.

s0285.literal: Once he wished to build a terrace, summoned craftsmen to calculate it, the cost was one hundred jin of gold.
s0285.idiomatic: Once he wished to build an open terrace and summoned craftsmen to calculate the costâ€”it came to one hundred jin of gold.
